intro: Mesosphaerum dictiocalyx, commonly known as the silky mesosphaerum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, silky hairs covering its stems and leaves, giving it a soft, fuzzy appearance. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
